class.name: SoftBody
class.description: A deformable physics body. Used to create elastic or deformable objects such as cloth, rubber, or other flexible materials.

method.name: add_collision_exception_with
method.description: Adds a body to the list of bodies that this body can't collide with.

method.name: get_collision_exceptions
method.description: Returns an array of nodes that were added as collision exceptions for this body.

method.name: get_collision_layer_bit
method.description: Returns an individual bit on the collision mask.

method.name: get_collision_mask_bit
method.description: Returns an individual bit on the collision mask.

method.name: remove_collision_exception_with
method.description: Removes a body from the list of bodies that this body can't collide with.

method.name: set_collision_layer_bit
method.description: Sets individual bits on the layer mask. Use this if you only need to change one layer's value.

method.name: set_collision_mask_bit
method.description: Sets individual bits on the collision mask. Use this if you only need to change one layer's value.

members.member: The physics layers this SoftBody is in. Collidable objects can exist in any of 32 different layers. These layers work like a tagging system, and are not visual. A collidable can use these layers to select with which objects it can collide, using the collision_mask property. A contact is detected if object A is in any of the layers that object B scans, or object B is in any layer scanned by object A. See [url=https://docs.godotengine.org/en/3.3/tutorials/physics/physics_introduction.html#collision-layers-and-masks]Collision layers and masks[/url] in the documentation for more information.

The physics layers this SoftBody scans for collisions. See [url=https://docs.godotengine.org/en/3.3/tutorials/physics/physics_introduction.html#collision-layers-and-masks]Collision layers and masks[/url] in the documentation for more information.
[NodePath] to a [CollisionObject] this SoftBody should avoid clipping.
Increasing this value will improve the resulting simulation, but can affect performance. Use with care.
